# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)
    wrapped_text = ""
    
    for word in split(text)
        if length(wrapped_text) + length(word) > text_width
            wrapped_text *= "\n" # add a new line
            wrapped_text += word # start with the next word
        else
            wrapped_text *= " " # add space if within limit
            wrapped_text += word
        end
    end
    
    return wrapped_text
end

# Example usage
text = "This is a long example text that needs to be wrapped when its length exceeds the `text_width` parameter."
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, 15)
println(wrapped_text)
```

In this example, the function `wrap_string` takes a string (`text`) and an optional `text_width` parameter. It iterates over each word in the text and adds a new line if the combined length of the current and next words exceeds the specified `text_width`. The wrapped text is returned as a single string.
